description: From Latin simile (“comparison, likeness, parallel”) (first attested 1393), originally from simile, neuter form of similis (“like, similar, resembling”). Compare English similar.

nouns.description: simile (countable and uncountable, plural similes or similia)

entries.meaning: A figure of speech in which one thing is explicitly compared to another, using e.g. like or as.
examples: Coordinate term: (when the comparison is implicit) metaphor
